org.middleheaven.io.repository
Class TextFile

java.lang.Object
  org.middleheaven.io.repository.TextFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContentSource, ManagedFile, Watchable
public class TextFile
extends java.lang.Object

ManagedFile decorator that provides text specific methods. Useful to handle text files.

canRenameTo

public boolean canRenameTo(java.lang.String newBaseName)
determines if the base name of this file can be changed to a new one. It can not be changed if a file with that name already exists. Some implementations may not support the rename operation

getSize

public long getSize()
             throws ManagedIOException
For FILE managed files it returns the same as getContent().getSize for FOLDER managed files it returns the sum of inner FILE and FOLDER getSize()

Specified by:
getSize in interface ManagedFile
Returns:

createFile

public ManagedFile createFile()
                       throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
If this is of type ManagedFileType.VIRTUAL create and return a ManagedFile file on the URL pointed by this. The new file substitutes this on its parent. If this is not of type ManagedFileType.VIRTUAL and this is of type ManagedFileType.FILE is returned. Else an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown;

Specified by:
createFile in interface ManagedFile
Returns:
the created file
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this is not of VIRTUAL or FILE type, or this operation is not implemented on the target class.

createFolder

public ManagedFile createFolder()
                         throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
If this is of type ManagedFileType.VIRTUAL create and return a folder on the URL pointed by this. The new file substitutes this on its parent. If this is not of type ManagedFileType.VIRTUAL and this is of type ManagedFileType.FOLDER is returned. Else an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown;

Specified by:
createFolder in interface ManagedFile
Returns:
the created folder
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this is not of VIRTUAL or FOLDER type, or this operation is not implemented on the target class.
